description: Learn The Prefrontal Cortex and Control in one minute.

hook.text: A teenager screams in rage. An adult takes a breath and responds calmly. The difference is prefrontal maturity.

buildup.text: The prefrontal cortex is the brain's executive manager â€” it regulates impulses, plans, and manages emotions.

discovery.text: It doesn't suppress emotion. It modulates it â€” like a volume dial, not an off switch.

twist.text: The prefrontal cortex isn't fully mature until around age 25. That's why teens are emotionally volatile.

climax.text: Emotional intelligence isn't about having fewer emotions. It's about having a well-trained prefrontal cortex.

punchline.text: The brain's brake pedal takes 25 years to fully install.
